text: Wow, I can't believe someone could be trapped in Vim for 5 years. I mean, I know it's a running joke, but this is next level.
Haha, yeah. It's like the Hotel California of text editors – you can check out any time you like, but you can never leave.
I've heard of some people getting stuck for a few hours or even days, but 5 years is just insane. The dedication is impressive, though.
I bet they've become a Vim master now. They could probably navigate and manipulate text faster than the speed of light.
Absolutely! If anything, they'll have a tough time readjusting to using other text editors now. Imagine trying to use nano after 5 years in Vim.
Speaking of nano, I remember a friend of mine who used to call it "Vim for Dummies." Now that I think about it, maybe it's not such a bad thing to be trapped in Vim after all.
I wonder if there's a support group for people who've escaped Vim. You know, like Vim Anonymous or something.
If there isn't one, we should definitely start it. It could be like a 12-step program to help people reintegrate into the world of non-modal text editors.
Step 1: Admitting you have a problem. "Hi, I'm [insert name] and I've been stuck in Vim for [insert number] years."
